How I Tested Betr Picks
After completing the brief registration process at Betr Picks, my new account was ready to go.
In terms of functionality, I had no problem navigating the app. I found that it was incredibly easy to make selections and lock in my picks. Betr offers a wide selection of different sports and leagues to choose from, covering everything from NFL markets to UFC offerings.
Some independent reviews have suggested that there is frustrating lag on the app, and it has logged some users out on occasions. This may be the case for some, but personally, I have not experienced such an issue thus far.
One drawback that did affect my gaming experience with Betr Picks is the brand’s lack of a desktop platform. While its mobile app definitely passes the test, not offering a website limits a large number of users who prefer to place their picks via desktop.
Overall, the app-only product was still a pleasure to use and is definitely high on my shortlist of recommended daily fantasy sports platforms.

What Makes Betr Picks Unique?
As you might expect from a company backed by Jake Paul, Betr Picks is uniquely transparent. When you head to the platform, you can uncover headshots and full biographies of the main parties involved.
Betr Picks also covers a wide range of sports. Each of the core American professional leagues are available. You can play DFS games involving the NFL, NBA, MLB and NHL. Major League Soccer is also covered, while fantasy options are also included for golf, UFC and others.
Along with picking team rosters, there is the option to make fantasy picks for individual players. For example, you can predict the number of passing yards that Patrick Mahomes will throw for in an NFL game.
It would be nice to see some international competitions included in the future. For instance, there aren’t any DFS options for English Premier League soccer yet.
